events.message: The customer reported a car collision on April 28th involving another vehicle at a busy intersection. They filed a claim promptly for the damages to their auto.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident as it involves a vehicle collision and resulting damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim to ensure proper follow-up and communication.
Insurance company sent official acknowledgment to the claimant confirming receipt of the accident claim for the vehicle damage.
The agent requested a copy of the police report, photos of the damaged car, and a repair estimate from the customer.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report, multiple photos of the vehicle damage, and official repair estimates.
The insurance team began a thorough investigation into the accident circumstances and liability based on submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded with clear determination that the other party was primarily at fault for the collision.
The insurer proposed a fair settlement amount to cover all the damages and repair costs for the customer's damaged vehicle.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and timely communication throughout the claim process.
The insurance company officially approved the claim for the full settlement amount after customer acceptance.
Payment was promptly issued to the customer’s bank account to cover the repair expenses as per the approved settlement.
The claim was officially closed following payment disbursement, completing the processing of the auto accident claim.
All documents and records related to the customer’s vehicle accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
